bib.title: Social network structure is predictive of health and wellness
bib.author: Lin, Suwen and Faust, Louis and Robles-Granda, Pablo and Kajdanowicz, Tomasz and Chawla, Nitesh V
bib.abstract: Social networks influence health-related behavior, such as obesity and smoking. While researchers have studied social networks as a driver for diffusion of influences and behavior, it is less understood how the structure or topology of the network, in itself, impacts an individual's health behavior and wellness state. In this paper, we investigate whether the structure or topology of a social network offers additional insight and predictability on an individual's health and wellness. We develop a method called the Network-Driven health
bib.publisher: Public Library of Science San Francisco, CA USA
